DCC001-DN264087-76075911,Contract,"Durham County Council",Awarded,2017-08-14T10:17:12Z,"Provider Panel for Short Breaks to meet Assessed Needs","Durham County Council and Clinical Commissioning Groups are seeking to appoint a Panel of Providers to provide a range of short break services to meet the assessed needs of those families with SEND requiring short breaks to provide early help to prevent needs from escalating and to support those with complex needs (Age 0 to 25).  This has been split into 3 individual lots depending on the type of session/service required:-
Lot 1 - Short Breaks for Assessed Needs (Age 0 to 5)
Lot 2 - Short Breaks for Assessed Needs (Age 6 to 13)
Lot 3 - Short Breaks for Assessed Needs (Age 14 to 25)

Providers can bid to provide services in a single Lot, or a combination of any or all of the Lots detailed above.  Please access the tender for full details of the specification and tender submission requirements.",,,"North East","80000000 85000000 ","Kay Duthie",kay.duthie@durham.gov.uk,"Corporate services","County Hall",Durham,"DH1 5UL","United Kingdom",,http://www.durham.gov.uk,,,,01/09/2017,01/09/2019,23/06/2017,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,1600000,1600000,18/07/2017,1600000,"[Durham Area Disability Leisure Group

column1: NCCT41120 - AWARD,Contract,"Norfolk County Council",Awarded,2016-12-21T16:39:53Z,"Short Breaks for Children with Disabilities. - AWARD","Norfolk County Council has established a framework of providers of short breaks for children with disabilities. Short Breaks allow a child to spend time apart from their parent/carer, take part in activities they like, form and develop friendships and become more confident and independent. Short Breaks allow the child's family to have a break from the demands of caring, to relax and recharge their batteries, to spend time with each other and their other children and to reduce family stress.

There is no guarantee of business under this framework.  As a guide, the Council's potential spend is up to £1.7 million per annum. However this does not represent a commitment to purchase the value stated, either as a minimum or a maximum, under the framework. Orders placed under the framework will be awarded on an individual basis.",,"NR1 2DH","East of England","85000000 85311300 85312120 ","Andrew Fish",andrew.fish@norfolk.gov.uk,"Martineau Lane",Norwich,Norfolk,"NR1 2DH","United Kingdom",01603223299,www.norfolk.gov.uk,,,,01/04/2017,31/03/2021,05/12/2016,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,0,,02/01/2017,0,"[About With Friends

LGSS001-DN412738-65359457,Contract,"Cambridgeshire County Council",Awarded,2019-09-17T14:34:56Z,"Cambridgeshire County Council Framework for Community Short Breaks for Disabled Children and Young People","Cambridgeshire County Council (The Council) are inviting Providers to apply/reapply to deliver a range of activities for disabled children and young people living within Cambridgeshire. These will be children and young people with disabilities up to the age of 19 years and may require assistance with personal care. However, The Provider may need to be able to continue to support young beyond the age of 19. The call-off procedure for this framework is based on the choice of parents and children and therefore Cambridgeshire County Council would welcome applications from a wide range of providers delivering a wide range of activities based on personal allowance.",,,"East Midlands","85000000 ",,contracts@milton-keynes.gov.uk,"Shire Hall",,Cambridge,"CB3 0AP",England,,https://www.lgss.co.uk/about/,,,,01/10/2019,30/09/2029,08/07/2019,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,1700000,,21/08/2019,1700000,"[Romsey Mill Trust

column1: LEICSCC001-DN305365-17280710,Contract,"Leicestershire County Council",Awarded,2018-10-01T14:29:21Z,"Short Breaks, Domiciliary Care and Early Support & Inclusion for Children with Disabilities (Annual Refresh 2018)","Leicestershire County Council is undertaking a procurement process to identify and appoint a number of service providers to provide a range of disabled children's services as follows;

Short Breaks provide opportunities for disabled children and young people to spend time away from their parents and carers, with friends and peers, for positive opportunities. They are intended to promote their positive mental health and emotional well-being.

Domiciliary care is a statutory service that the Council has a duty to provide and it relates to the provision of care and support to children and families in their own home (e.g. personal care, meal preparation, moving andhandling etc.).

The framework started on 01 April 2017 but includes an annual refresh which allows for the framework to be reopened so that additional providers can tender for inclusion on the framework.",,,"East Midlands","92000000 98000000 85300000 ","CFS Commissioning Support",CFSCommissioningSupport@leics.gov.uk,"County Hall",Glenfield,Leicester,"LE3 8RF",England,"+44 1162323232",http://www.leicestershire.gov.uk,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=6e6fa14b-f5be-e711-80e6-005056b64545 ",,01/04/2018,31/03/2019,15/12/2017,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,2440000,2440000,31/03/2018,2440000,"[New Leaf Triangle CIC
